author: Laura Nahmias
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams will announce his decision to stay in the race for a second term, according to his campaign chair Frank Carone.
title: NYC’s Adams to Announce He’s Staying in Mayor Race, Carone Says

author: Lydia Beyoud
description: PredictIt, a popular but previously unlicensed exchange for political junkies to put money on election outcomes, has won approval to expand operations as a regulated derivatives exchange, according to documents released Friday.
title: PredictIt Gains CFTC Approval to Launch Regulated Exchange

author: Alex Wickham, Ailbhe Rea
description: The loss of a top deputy was bound to plunge Keir Starmer’s government into crisis. The British prime minister did what he could to turn a bad day into a chance to save his premiership.
title: Starmer Bids to Rebuild Premiership From Wreckage Left by Rayner

author: David Voreacos
description: In its campaign to pressure elite US colleges to make a wide range of policy changes, the administration of President Donald Trump has come down hardest on Harvard University.
title: Here Are the Many Ways Trump Is Attacking Harvard

author: Alicia Diaz
description: Senator Dave McCormick, an ally of President Donald Trump, urged the White House to consider tariffs and restricting Norway’s access to US markets in response to the Norwegian sovereign wealth fund’s decision to divest from Texas-based Caterpillar Inc.
title: Norway Wealth Fund Divestment Draws GOP Senator McCormick’s Ire

author: Dan Williams, Ethan Bronner, Fadwa Hodali
description: As Israel’s war in Gaza approaches the two-year mark, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s ultra-nationalist coalition partners are urging annexation of the West Bank, the larger of the Palestinian territories neighboring Israel. Netanyahu has been reticent about if or when this might happen, but he voted with the majority in July when parliament passed a non-binding resolution to apply sovereignty to Israeli settlement blocs in the West Bank. Netanyahu stirred further speculation about expansion
title: What Israel’s Push Toward West Bank Annexation Means

author: Michael Sasso, Jordan Fabian
description: A renaissance in US manufacturing promised by President Donald Trump seems, at least for now, to be moving in reverse.
title: Trump’s Factory Boom Stalled for Now as Payrolls Keep Shrinking

author: Laura Nahmias, Georgia Hall
description: In July, New York City Mayor Eric Adams was predicting that by this point in his race for reelection, he’d be proving his doubters wrong, surging in the polls.
title: Everything’s Going Wrong for NYC’s Adams in Bid for Reelection

author: Chris Anstey, Daniel Flatley
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent blasted the Federal Reserve for putting its own independence at risk through “mission creep” and called for an independent review of the US central bank, including its monetary policy.
title: Bessent Wants Independent Fed Review, Including Monetary Policy

author: William Horobin, Alice Gledhill
description: The French government is likely to collapse on Monday after its attempts to deal with a ballooning fiscal deficit were rejected.
title: Political Paralysis Puts France In Market’s Crosshairs

author: Slav Okov
description: Bulgarian authorities are looking into alleged Russian signals jamming as questions arise over an incident that affected an aircraft carrying European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen this week.
title: Bulgaria Shows Caution Amid Questions Over EU Chief Jamming Case

author: Josh Wingrove, Lisa Abramowicz, Jonathan Ferro
description: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick zeroed in on Switzerland’s flagship pharmaceutical industry, saying that the country is “so rich” because of its vast exports of drugs to the US.
title: Lutnick Targets Swiss Pharma Giants for Making Money Off America

author: Gresa Kraja
description: Kosovo’s top court has suspended all steps toward forming a new government until the end of September, extending a political deadlock that’s gripped the Balkan nation since elections earlier this year.
title: Kosovo Faces New Deadlock as Court Freezes Government Formation

author: Lauren Rosenthal, Zahra Hirji
description: Cameron Hamilton’s tenure was short and marked by a struggle over the agency’s future.
title: Trump’s Ex-FEMA Chief Says Killing Agency Puts Public at ‘Extreme Risk’

author: Alex Wickham
description: Keir Starmer reshuffled the UK Cabinet on Friday afternoon following the resignation of his No. 2, Angela Rayner, swapping a number of senior ministers in a bid to relaunch his faltering year-old government.
title: Cooper to Be UK Foreign Secretary, Lammy Deputy Premier

author: Francesca Maglione, Amanda Albright
description: Vanderbilt University, a happy ‘unicorn’ of higher education, is drawing fire from its peers for not standing up to the White House.
title: Football, Academics and No Politics: Vanderbilt Booms in Trump Era

author: Brian Platt
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney rolled out a multi-billion dollar relief package for Canadian businesses battered by tariffs imposed by both the US and China.
title: Carney Unveils Billions in Relief for Canada’s Tariff-Hit Firms

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: India denied a news story that said a letter from Chinese President Xi Jinping to his Indian counterpart played a role in the thawing of tensions between the neighbors.
title: India Denies Report That Xi’s Letter Helped Revive Ties

author: Sri Taylor
description: A Philadelphia judge ruled Thursday that the state’s largest transit system must halt all of its current and planned service cuts, while allowing planned fare hikes to move forward.
title: Judge Bars Philadelphia Transit Service Cuts, Allows Fare Hike

author: Lucy White
description: Reform UK leader Nigel Farage said he’s preparing his party for power in a general election he predicted could come as soon as 2027, with the governing Labour Party in “crisis.”
title: Farage Say He’s Preparing Reform for UK Power as Soon as 2027

author: Olivia Poh
description: Singapore must resist external manipulation from “near and far,” President Tharman Shanmugaratnam said, warning of foreign actors who will seek to advance their agendas in the city-state.
title: Singapore President Warns of Manipulation by Foreign Actors

author: Gregory Korte
description: The Trump administration plans to rewrite the playbook for government hiring, allowing managers to select from a broader list of qualified candidates instead of having to choose from the top three scorers on a competitive exam.
title: Trump Administration Ending a Hiring Rule Dating to 19th Century

author: Jordan Fabian, Laura Curtis, Enda Curran
description: Donald Trump promised to slash red tape for business. His tariff regime has gotten American companies increasingly tangled up in it.
title: Trump’s Tariffs Leave US Business Tied Up in Costly Red Tape

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: In the middle of Thailand’s most recent political crisis, conservative politician Anutin Charnvirakul chatted at a snazzy bar with the country’s second-richest man and shared a homemade lunch with a powerful former general. Pictures of both meetings splashed across social media.
title: Pro-Cannabis Politician Becomes Third Thai Premier in Two Years

author: Michael J Kavanagh
description: Soldiers and rebels in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo have committed rapes, kidnappings, executions and attacked hospitals and schools, the United Nations Human Rights Office said.
title: War Crimes Widespread in Eastern Congo Conflict, UN Alleges

author: Michael Nienaber
description: Germany plans to purchase three Heron drones for nearly €1 billion ($1.2 billion) from Israel despite growing calls from European allies to increase the pressure on Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to stop his military offensive in Gaza.
title: Germany Buys Military Drones From Israel Despite Gaza Criticism

author: John Tozzi
description: The US government appears to be behind on its goal of hiring staff to audit private Medicare Advantage insurance plans for potential overpayments, casting doubt on how quickly it can clear a yearslong backlog that the new administration promised to tackle.
title: Medicare’s Plan to Hire 2,000 Auditors Appears to Stall

author: Ruchi Bhatia
description: India’s Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the country will continue buying Russian oil, signaling its intent to defy US President Donald Trump’s persistent demands to halt the purchases.
title: India Will Keep Buying Russian Oil, Finance Minister Says

author: Ailbhe Rea, Alex Wickham
description: UK Deputy Prime Minister Angela Rayner resigned from her post after a watchdog’s investigation into her tax affairs, triggering a government reshuffle and throwing Keir Starmer’s premiership into further disarray.
title: UK Deputy PM Angela Rayner Quits, Triggering Reshuffle

author: Nayla Razzouk
description: France’s biggest farming groups asked the government to block a European Union free-trade agreement with South American countries, warning it fails to protect agricultural producers from cheaper imports.
title: France’s Farmers Push to Block EU-Mercosur Trade Agreement

author: Alan Crawford
description: President Donald Trump has tipped the renewables industry into crisis as he pushes for more oil and gas
title: Wind Wars Highlight US-China Divergence on Clean Energy

author: Charlie Duxbury
description: Sweden’s former national security adviser has been acquitted of negligently handling sensitive documents, in a legal ruling which provides some relief for a government that had been under fire over the case.
title: Sweden’s Former Security Adviser Acquitted in Negligence Case

author: Jasmina Kuzmanovic, Misha Savic
description: A planned referendum in the Serb-run half of Bosnia-Herzegovina on defying the central authorities won’t be valid regardless of its result, said the top diplomat overseeing the Balkan country’s postwar settlement.
title: Bosnia Envoy Dismisses Serb Separatist Referendum as Illegal

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Jonathan Ferro, Lisa Abramowicz
description: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said that he will meet with a visiting Swiss delegation bringing a “new proposal” to secure better tariff rates on their country’s exports but isn’t optimistic the two economies will reach a deal.
title: Lutnick Will Meet With Swiss Delegation, But Expects Little

author: Manuela Tobias, Nicolle Yapur
description: Milei Targets Peronist Heartland in Argentina’s High-Stakes Vote
title: Milei Targets Peronist Heartland in Argentina’s High-Stakes Vote

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat, Suttinee Yuvejwattana
description: Thailand’s parliament elected Anutin Charnvirakul prime minister on Friday, the nation’s third leader since 2023, in a move that may offer only a brief period of political calm.
title: Anutin Elected New Thai Premier as Political Turmoil Eases

author: Hallie Gu
description: China slapped preliminary duties on pork imports from the European Union, a move set to disrupt shipments from one of the world’s biggest suppliers and further stoke trade tensions between Brussels and Beijing.
title: China Hits EU Pork With Initial Duties Up to 62% After Probe

description: Angela Rayner is expected to face a crunch moment on Friday as she battles for her political future.
title: Angela Rayner Faces Crunch Moment as Ethics Probe Set to Report on Tax Row

author: Eddie Spence, Claire Jiao
description: Protest organizers in Jakarta are planning to stage a gathering in the form of a picnic outside Indonesia’s parliament building as police crack down on violent demonstrations.
title: Jakarta Set for ‘Picnic’ Protest as Police Crack Down on Unrest

author: Sanne Wass, Sara Sjolin
description: Danes should consider joining the euro if they want a bigger role in the European Union, according to their central bank chief, who hinted that such a move could insulate the nation from global turbulence.
title: Denmark Should Consider Euro for Deeper EU Ties, Governor Says

author: Samy Adghirni, Laura Malsch
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz voiced exasperation that Europe lacks the clout to force Russia to end its war in Ukraine after the US continued to stall on providing security guarantees or agree on sanctions.
title: Merz Frustrated With Ukraine Talks as Putin Warns Against Troops

author: Erica Yokoyama, Keiko Ujikane
description: Japan will raise its minimum hourly wage by a record 6.3% to ¥1,121 ($7.56), reinforcing the nation’s wage-price cycle and supporting the case for the Bank of Japan to keep hiking rates.
title: Japan to Hike Minimum Pay by Record, Backing BOJ’s Rate Hikes

author: Phila Siu, Olivia Tam
description: Police in China detained a man for comments critical of President Xi Jinping’s military parade, highlighting the ruling Communist Party’s intolerance of dissent.
title: China Detains Man for ‘Defamatory’ Remarks About Xi’s Parade

author: Zoe Schneeweiss
description: Francois Bayrou’s likely ouster as French premier next week will leave his successor with a persisting headache over the sustainability of the country’s debt, Bloomberg Economics says.
title: France’s ‘Perilous’ Debt Path Is Headache for Bayrou’s Successor

author: Paul Vecchiatto
description: South Africa’s defense department requested a postponement of joint exercises with the Russian and Chinese navies scheduled for November in the North Asian nation.
title: South Africa Seeks Delay of Russia-China War Games During G-20

author: Beril Akman
description: Turkey’s central bank Governor Fatih Karahan struck an optimistic note on the inflation outlook following worse-than-expected data and market turmoil, suggesting investors may have been too hasty in reducing their forecasts for interest-rate cuts.
title: Turkey’s Central Bank Governor Upbeat on Inflation as Banks Redraw Rate Path

author: Moses Mozart Dzawu
description: Former Credit Suisse AG Chief Executive Officer Tidjane Thiam vowed to press ahead with his presidential ambitions in Ivory Coast, even after being barred from next month’s elections in the West African nation.
title: Thiam Vows to Fight On in Bid to Become President of Ivory Coast

author: Swati Gupta
description: India’s Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said negotiations with the US on the trade deal should be allowed to continue and that there was no need to “panic” over the delay.
title: India Minister Says Don’t ‘Panic’ Over Delay in US Trade Deal

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Japan risks having to pay higher tariffs if it doesn’t fund US President Donald Trump’s investment recommendations, according to a document fleshing out a $550 billion funding initiative agreed by the two nations in July.
title: Japan Risks Higher Tariffs If It Shuns Trump’s Investment Picks

author: Lucy White
description: Fresh from telling US lawmakers that curbs on online speech have plunged the UK into “authoritarianism,” Nigel Farage will be trying to keep his own party’s representatives in check at Reform UK’s biggest gathering yet.
title: Farage Dogged by Restive Right While Courting Britain’s Middle

author: Sanne Wass, Sara Sjolin
description: Denmark’s central bank will cut its economic outlook for 2025 substantially because of weaker sales growth at Novo Nordisk A/S and US tariffs, according to its governor.
title: Novo Nordisk Woes and Trump’s Tariffs Dent Danish Growth Outlook

author: Sakura Murakami, Gareth Allan
description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba reiterated his intention to stay on as leader after securing the lowering of US auto tariffs, dismissing the view that implementation of the trade deal with Washington might change his mind.
title: Japan’s Ishiba Reaffirms Intent to Stay On After Tariffs Lowered

author: David Voreacos
description: Supreme Court Justice Amy Coney Barrett downplayed President Donald Trump’s sharp barbs directed at federal judges, telling a New York crowd that US presidents have a long history of criticizing the judiciary.
title: Justice Barrett Calls Trump Barbs a ‘Dance We’ve Seen Before’

author: Courtney McBride
description: Two Venezuelan military aircraft flew over an American naval vessel in international waters off, according to the Pentagon, with the US reportedly deploying stealth fighter jets in response as tensions rise between the two adversaries.
title: Venezuelan Fly-By Ratchets Up Tension After US Strikes Drug Boat

author: Erik Larson
description: Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook said that a court ruling in favor of Harvard University this week backs her argument that President Donald Trump’s attempt to fire her for alleged mortgage fraud is a pretext cloaking his ulterior motive.
title: Cook Says Harvard Funding Fight Shows Trump’s Hidden Motives

author: Josh Wingrove, Lauren Dezenski
description: Meta Platforms Inc.’s Mark Zuckerberg and Apple Inc.’s Tim Cook joined tech industry leaders in touting their pledges to boost spending in the US on artificial intelligence during a dinner hosted by President Donald Trump that highlighted his deepening relationship with Silicon Valley.
title: Trump Basks in Tech Leaders’ Spending Vows at White House Dinner

author: Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump said he would like to see two candidates drop out of the race for New York City mayor in order to improve the chances of ending democratic socialist Zohran Mamdani’s bid for the job.
title: Trump Says Two Candidates Should Drop Out of NYC Mayor Race

author: Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump said he would be imposing tariffs on semiconductor imports “very shortly” but spare goods from companies like Apple Inc. that have pledged to boost their US investments.
title: Trump Says ‘Fairly Substantial’ Chips Tariffs Coming ‘Shortly’
